ygData.subject: Re: How addicted??
ygData.msgSnippet: HEHE-- fellow addicts -- i love it!!! Here are some things I do-- 1. When I m hungry and want to play EQ, I ll put some bread or muffins and milk
ygData.messageBody:
HEHE-- fellow addicts -- i love it!!!<br><br>Here
are some things I do--<br><br>1. When I'm hungry and
want to play EQ, I'll put some bread or muffins and
milk or water in a bag or a backpack, and hope that
somehow I automatically eat them. <br><br>2. When I'm
driving (usually home to play EQ) and someone cuts me off
or I see a red light, I'll start hearing that
familiar battle music. Also happens when someone ticks me
off. <br><br>3. When working out (which I do very
little of now that EQ flexes my brain, mouse hand, and
typing fingers plenty), I'll /con other guys in the gym.
If I keep benching and squating, maybe that guy in
the Everlast shirt will end up "you would have the
upper hand," instead of "tombstone." <br><br>4. I run
everywhere. Why would you walk? Also, if I get fatigued, I
sit down with my legs crossed and open up a book.
<br><br>5. I've seen this posted on other boards, and find
myself with the same desire to jump into any body of
watter to practice my swimming skill. <br><br>6. When I
get change at a restuarant, I look at each $1.00 and
think "Hey, 9 more and i'll have a plat.!!"<br><br>7.
When I'm at the store, and can't find my something I
really want, I have the urge to shout "Want to buy
___x___, send tell!!!" But then I remember that I should
/auction instead of /shout, so I just quitely check the
shelf again. <br><br>8. When on-line in a chat room
with friends (which happens less often now, because
that's time I could be on EQ), my friends are perplexed
when each of my entries starts with "/g ____" or
"/tell Steve ____" <br><br>9. On the same line, I was in
a chat room with 3 friends last week and one friend
was being a jerk. So I type "/tell Mike Dude, Steve's
lame! Why is he trying to blame you for HIS car running
out of gas?" After I realized what I did (and still
partially in EQ-world), I typed "uh... sorry, wrong
tell."<br><br>10. When at the mall, I was standing in line when I
noticed a really cute girl smiling at me. I immediately
thought "/who all that hot chick" And laughed when my
brain spit out -- "Miranda, [High School Student]age17
latina, Los Angeles" (Hmm... too low level to share
experience with). <br><br>11. I was walking down the hall at
work, when an obnoxious co-worker say me. I tried to
"hide," but I guess he had see invisible. After an
unpleasant encounter with him (which ended in me fleeing for
the zone -- aka elevator), I thought "what a stupid
newbie mistake, he must have been undead-- THAT's what
hide wouldn't work"<br><br>12. My dad was going to
give me this great TV because he was getting a new big
screen. He said "do you want it?" I said "i'm kinda low
on plat right now, haven't banked lately." He looked
at me like I was nuts, and said, "no, i'll give it
to you." I hesitated for a minute, wondering if this
kind of twinking was ok. <br><br>13. I am convinced
that my sense heading is maxed out, so I never travel
with a map. Then I wish I hadn't been been too cheap
to buy True North when my girlfriend says "You have
no idea what direction you're facing!!!" <br><br>14.
I recently took 2 days off from EQ to go to Vegas.
I won a big hand in poker, and yelled out "WOOT"!!
Everyone looked at me like I was crazy, except the
blackjack dealer at the next table, who walked by me and
said quietly, "Xersi on the Drinal server."<br><br>15.
I renamed my dog Gobabaner. I have to constantly
repeat comands to him, because he's as thick as a water
elemental. /pet back off, /pet guard here. When I leave him
inside sometimes, I wonder who wandered by and cast
Burnout on him-- he always seems "to go
berzerk."<br><br>There are more, but I need to get back to the game. /g
See you all on-line!!!<br><br>Xela Orcbane<br>20th
season Druid<br>Xev
